titleInfo.title: ‘Rough copy of a Plan of the Telegraph Station & neighbourhood at Henjam [Jazīreh-ye Hengām] prepared under orders of Capt. J. B. Eustace R.N. [Royal Navy] Cmd H.M.S. “Fox” by Lieut. G. Bevan R.N. in April, 1906’

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: 1 paper folio.Dimensions: 520 x 820 mm.Foliation:The map is foliated with a circled pencil number in the top right corner.

mods.abstract: The map, drawn by Lieutenant G H Bevan of HMS Foxduring an expedition which took place in April 1906, is of the northern tip of Hengam Island [Jazīreh-ye Hengām]. The map’s key indicates good roads, tracks, and water tanks, each of which is allocated a number. The map also indicates various buildings including the British telegraph office, along with its gardens, the Persian customs hut, flagstaffs, mosques and other structures. Key geological features are also labelled, as are watercourses. Off the coast of the island, the locations of submarine telegraph cables are indicated, as are depth soundings, given in fathoms. Running along the bottom of the map is a straight red line labelled ‘Boundary Line’, which indicates the proposed extent of the British telegraph concession.The map should be read in conjunction with the accompanying correspondence, including reports of the expedition written by Captain John Bridges Eustace, Senior Naval Officer of the Persian Gulf Division, and Commanding Officer of HMS Fox(ff 10-15).
